If you take your child to the Doctor please bring a Doctor's note in their returning day.

Region 3 TSATA Spotlight: Christian Aviles, River Road High School

Christian works tirelessly with his River Road kids and goes above and beyond to make visiting Athletic Trainers comfortable and have what they need when they visit River Road. Christian is also a great father and husband, taking care of his wife and 5 kids. Christian has not only had to take care of his own athletes during this time of COVID-19, but also himself sustaining a knee injury of his own that required surgery. Christian has and always will do all he can to take care of his own and any athletes that are playing at River Road that needs his assistance. Christian has also been involved with getting his athletes back involved with strength and conditioning, etc., now that the athletes can get back to working out. Christian is a gentleman and professional that we could all aspire to be more like.

- Jeremy Davis

We are so blessed to have so many people working together for our kiddos and community. Be sure to thank our heroes!

Dear RRISD Parents,

As you are probably now aware, Texas Governor Greg Abbott has ordered all Texas schools to close for two weeks. The order takes effect from midnight March 20 until midnight April 3. River Road ISD leaders are busy adjusting plans we had already begun developing for next week. Those plans will include opportunities for students who need meals to receive them and providing continued instruction for students at home through paper and online platforms. The governing body over school districts, the Texas Education Agency, has instructed schools to continue with instruction for students, but obviously it will look different than ever before. With the announcement of this executive order, many things are unclear for school districts like RRISD, but we are seeking guidance from the state and we will be communicating more info in the coming days as it becomes available.

The latest updates and information can be found on our website at www.rrisd.net

Thank you for your support,

River Road ISD Administration

post_text:
Big thanks to Potter County Sheriff Office and Potter County Fire-Rescue for coming out to train our staff today and present "Stop the Bleed". "Stop the Bleed" is a national awareness campaign whose goal is to encourage citizens to become equipped with the knowledge to help in life-threatening bleeding emergencies and implement life-saving measures while awaiting professional assistance.
The campaign is a partnership between the Amarillo Fire Department, Amarillo Medical Service, Amarillo Police Department, Randall County Fire Department, Potter County Fire Department and Canyon Fire Department.
The agencies installed kits in each of the schools, as well as trained staff members to use the kits.
The program focuses on training for simple, life-saving techniques in the event of any life-threatening bleeding. While the program was initiated in the wake of an active shooter event, the techniques are useful for any situation that may result in significant bleeding.
For more information visit stopthebleed.org

Logan was also chosen and recently played in the Red VS Blue ASCO All-Star classic in Lubbock. The mission of the ASCO All-Star Classic is to provide financial assistance to young players that have been permanently injured while playing or practicing the game of football.

Free Dental Clinic at the Amarillo Civic Center

Texas Mission of Mercy (TMOM), a mobile dental clinic that delivers pain-relieving dental care at no cost to underserved Texans, will host an event in Amarillo on Friday and Saturday.
Patients seeking care will need to arrive by 5 a.m. on either Friday or Saturday at the Amarillo Civic Center to register. TMOM is a first-come, first-served event, and the clinic will stop accepting patients once capacity is reached. Patients must bring current medications.
More than 50 volunteer dentists and 300 volunteers from the dental profession, businesses and community groups will provide charitable care to the community of Amarillo and its surrounding area. The services, which are free, include basic, pain-relieving and preventative procedures such as dental cleanings, fillings and extractions.
This TMOM will also be able to provide a limited number of partial dentures so that some patients leave with new smiles.

For more information or to volunteer, contact TDASF Missions Manager Sara Harney at (512) 448-2441, ext. 203, or visit www.tdasf.org.
